This page provides our most frequently asked questions regarding our service.

l: Which DNS record types are supported?
p: We support the following DNS record types:
A
AAAA
CAA
CNAME
DS
Note: Must be used alongside NS records for DNSSEC.
MX
NS
Note: Only approved in specific cases. See Who can use NS records? for details.
SRV
TLSA
TXT
URL
Note: This is not a true DNS record. It is a custom made redirector specifically for is-a.dev.

l: Why does my domain still redirect to the is-a.dev homepage?
p: This usually happens due to browser caching. Clear your browser cache and try again.

l: Can I use a CNAME record with other record types?
p: No, unless the domain is proxied. A CNAME cannot be combined with other record types ( A, MX, TXT, etc.) in the same record set. For exceptions and setup instructions, see Proxying Your Domain.

l: How long does it take for my pull request to be merged?
p: We're a team of volunteers, and is-a.dev is a side project for us, so review times can vary. We'll get to your PR as soon as we can. To potentially speed things up, share your PR link in #pull-requests on our Discord server.

l: Which platforms or services are supported?
p: While you can use almost any service, these are the most commonly used with is-a.dev:
Cloudflare Pages
GitHub Pages
Netlify
Railway
Vercel

l: Can I create nested subdomains (e.g., sub.example.is-a.dev)?
p: Yes! You can nest subdomains as deeply as you'd like. To create one, name your file like blog.example.json. You must own example.is-a.dev to register blog.example.is-a.dev.

l: I get an SSL error using GitHub Pages. How do I fix it?
p: Go to your GitHub Pages settings for your repository and enable "Enforce HTTPS". This resolves most SSL issues.

l: Can I become a maintainer or join the is-a.dev team?
p: We don't accept direct applications. Team members are handpicked, often based on community involvement and support activity. Even then, it does not guarantee a position.

l: I accidentally leaked sensitive data in my PR, what can I do?
p: If your PR has not been merged, contact us immediately:
Email: security@is-a.dev
Discord: @williamharrison
If your PR has already been merged, we cannot retroactively remove it.

l: Can I use my domain for a Minecraft server?
p: Yes, use an A record and an SRV record. Refer to this Namecheap article for guidance.
⚠️ Root subdomains (e.g., yourname.is-a.dev) must relate to software development as required in our Terms of Service. Use a nested subdomain (e.g., mc.yourname.is-a.dev) for Minecraft.
We allow NS records only when:
The standard DNS record types we support aren't sufficient.✅ You must provide clear, technical justification.
A DNS provider (e.g., Aternos) requires NS delegation.✅ You must provide documentation.
We do not allow NS records for:
Convenience or ease of use
Unverifiable or unsupported claims
Non-functional or placeholder purposes
Security concerns or abuse risk
⚠️ We reserve the right to deny any NS request at our discretion.

NS records give full control over DNS for a subdomain. That opens the door to misuse, abuse, and security concerns. To protect the community and domain integrity, we must be strict about who receives NS delegation.

l: How can I update or delete my is-a.dev subdomain?
p: Follow these steps:
Review the documentation and ToS.
Open your JSON file(in /domains/your-subdomain.json).
Make your changes(or delete the file if you're removing your domain).
Commit the changes to your fork.
Push them to your GitHub fork.
Open a pull request from your forked repo.
Wait for approval and merging by a maintainer.
💡 Keep an eye on your pull request, we may request changes before merging.
